rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses neutral language. 'killed off' uses 'killed' which is not listed as a high-potency verb.
The segment uses 'said' and 'infected' and 'will be quarantined' and 'killed off' (plain outcome) and 'detected', none triggering Q3.
No loaded rhetorical question is present in the segment.
This reports actions (quarantined, killed) and a positive fact (no human cases) but lacks explicit calming language.
The segment contains 'no human cases' (minimiser) but lacks an explicit scale contrast.
The segment contains the bare negation 'no human cases... have been detected' without an explicit calming cue.
